metadata.feature_description: Generate and manage page thumbnails in different sizes

steps.action: Navigate to Content > Pages and select Home page
steps.expected: Medium size thumbnail displayed in page details panel
steps.actual: Medium size thumbnail (120x105) displayed correctly showing page content preview

steps.action: Click on the thumbnail image to view large version
steps.actual: Large thumbnail displayed correctly in overlay showing full page preview with complete content

steps.action: Click on Our Products page thumbnail
steps.expected: Large thumbnail displayed for Our Products page
steps.actual: Large thumbnail displayed correctly showing Our Products page content with product images

steps.action: Click Add Page button to create new page
steps.expected: New page should show default/fallback thumbnail
steps.actual: Default fallback thumbnail (wireframe placeholder image) displayed for new page with Page ID: 0

steps.action: Select Search Results page to trigger thumbnail generation
steps.expected: Thumbnail should be generated showing actual page content
steps.actual: Thumbnail generated successfully showing search interface content. Network request confirmed: POST /API/personaBar/Thumbnails/CreateThumbnails => 200 OK

steps.action: Select Our Products page to view generated thumbnail
steps.expected: Thumbnail should show Our Products page content with product images
steps.actual: Auto-generated thumbnail displayed correctly with product categories visible

steps.action: Verify thumbnail files are served from cached location via network analysis
steps.expected: Thumbnails served from /Portals/0-System/Thumbnails/ folder with cache-busting timestamp
steps.actual: Confirmed via network requests: Thumbnails served from /Portals/0-System/Thumbnails/ with timestamp parameters (e.g., medium_21_5c637ace-68ee-4a85-8da1-b8a1ffd3ac05_en-US.png?id=639062498363713297) returning HTTP 200 OK

observations: Upload custom thumbnail functionality is API-based only (via CreateThumbnails endpoint) - no direct upload button exists in the UI. Thumbnails are auto-generated using html2canvas library when pages are viewed/edited.
Thumbnail sizes supported: XSmall (48x42), Small (60x53), Medium (120x105), Large (640x480) as defined in ThumbnailType enum.

Different page types use different fallback thumbnails: URL pages use page_link.svg, Tab redirect pages use page_existing.svg, File pages use page_file.svg, Normal pages without thumbnails use fallback-thumbnail.png.
Console warning observed: Canvas2D readback operations warning from html2canvas.js confirms thumbnail generation is actively running client-side.
